text:
When we started Internet 
access, which was

defined in baud rates - 
it was less than 10%
and today it's over
40% across most of the region.

And people are able to achieve
the kinds of speeds
that make commerce, fintech,
content distribution,
possible in the region.

In addition, one of the things we realized
after we came in was just

the need to accelerate because we found
the market was not that deep,

because distribution of this 
capacity we had landed on
the beach was not as easy as in markets
where the networks already existed.
And so we partnered with anyone

and everyone who was willing to help us
drive the growth of the ecosystem.

We partnered with one
of the technology incubators

that was instrumental in 
growing the tech industry in Lagos.

We worked together
to build infrastructure
into a part of Lagos called Yaba,
and that's where a lot of the startups

did their incubation or
started off in that district.
And by deploying fiber
infrastructure and providing services

at complimentary or highly discounted
rates to a lot of these companies,

they were able to prove their
business models and scale.
